description: A curated list of free (or mostly free) databases that are developer-friendly and reliable.

apis.name: Supabase
apis.description: Open-source Firebase alternative with PostgreSQL, auth, and storage.
apis.reason: Great all-in-one toolkit for modern apps.

apis.name: PlanetScale
apis.description: Serverless MySQL database with branching and deployment features.
apis.reason: Branch your DB like Git — painless dev workflow.

apis.name: Neon
apis.description: Serverless PostgreSQL with auto-scaling and branching.
apis.reason: Modern PostgreSQL with zero ops overhead.

apis.name: MongoDB Atlas
apis.description: Fully managed MongoDB with global clusters.
apis.reason: Easy to launch, great for flexible doc storage.

apis.name: Firebase Firestore
apis.description: Google’s NoSQL database with real-time sync.
apis.reason: Tight Google ecosystem integration, real-time by default.

apis.name: Redis Cloud
apis.description: Managed Redis with caching and data structures.
apis.reason: Crazy fast caching, perfect for performance boosts.

apis.name: InfluxDB Cloud
apis.reason: Best pick for metrics, events, and IoT data.

apis.name: CockroachDB
apis.description: Distributed SQL database with strong consistency.
apis.reason: Rock solid SQL that scales globally.

apis.name: Fauna
apis.description: Serverless doc database with GraphQL built-in.
apis.reason: GraphQL-first and super easy to query.

apis.name: DynamoDB
apis.description: Amazon’s NoSQL database with massive scale.
apis.reason: Battle-tested NoSQL, infinite scale, but pay attention to costs.

apis.name: SQLite
apis.description: Lightweight, file-based SQL database used everywhere.
apis.reason: Zero setup, portable, perfect for local dev and mobile apps.
